examples: And that psychological anguish takes a toll physically.
And within moments cries of anguish break out all over the forest.
I'm sure the choices are anguishing for everybody involved.
Let's start with that obvious scapegoat of adolescent anguish, hormones.
This was not the eerie whispering of demons, but a light tinkling that seemed to ease her anguish.
words.defineEn: to experience intense physical or emotional pain or distress
words.defineVi: trải qua nỗi đau hoặc sự đau khổ về thể xác hoặc tinh thần

examples: Even Sweden's most famous company, Ikea, refurbishes its furniture here.
Anyway, they were refurbished but still there was a catastrophic failure.
Trump spent $1 million to refurbish each plane.
Once in the U.S., he established himself in the world of shop design by refurbishing retailers, including at least one store on New York's Fifth Avenue.
So think of it as taking your processor and refurbishing it.
words.defineEn: to make a room or building look more attractive by repairing, redecorating, or cleaning it

examples: And for companies trying to burnish their green credentials, flying first class might be bad publicity and bad for business.
words.defineVi: đánh bóng và làm sáng bóng

examples: And for companies trying to burnish their green credentials, flying first class might be bad publicity and bad for business.

examples: Some of the food is blemished.
Oh, you normally have a blemish
It’s kind of like the food that has a blemish but it’s just as good.
One glaring blemish is the gap between the haves and the have nots.
JOE BIDEN, President of the United States: The idea that we have so many people dying every single day from gun violence in America is a blemish on our character as nation.
words.defineEn: add a flaw or blemish to; make imperfect or defective
words.defineVi: thêm một lỗ hổng hoặc nhược điểm vào; làm cho không hoàn hảo hoặc khiếm khuyết

examples: The politician was once the poster boy for honesty and integrity, but his recent scandals have tarnished his reputation.
This issue not only doesn't tarnish our golden years, it provides a sense of hope for a better future.
The envious politician attacked his opponent with baseless accusations, not realizing that envy shoots at others and wounds itself, as his own reputation was tarnished in the process.
Does this tarnish the reputation of the Communist Party as a credible problem-solver?
But Putin's moment of glory was tarnished by troubles just over Russia's border: in Ukraine.
words.defineEn: make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air; also used metaphorically
words.defineVi: làm bẩn hoặc đốm, như do tiếp xúc với không khí; cũng được sử dụng một cách ẩn dụ

examples: Skirmishes, raids, and full-on invasions are happening every day, causing millions of casualties.
And there was clearly a skirmish, a struggle of some sort, because Zimmerman had cuts on the back of his head.
Strange prophecies and visits from mysterious gypsies give way to the skirmishes and firing squads of repeated civil wars.
But instead of fighting over hills or pieces of land the winner of these individual skirmishes gets a few moments of your time, which in today's attention economy is super valuable.
Well, John, it is another skirmish in, as you put it, a long battle.
words.defineEn: to engage in a short argument
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một cuộc tranh luận ngắn

examples: These protesters were calling for closer alignment with Russia, brandishing the Russian flag.

In the House of Representatives, politicians traded insults and brandished weapons until a Sargent at Arms restored order.

words.defineEn: move or swing back and forth
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc xoay qua lại

examples: No big deal, the losses are quickly replenished.

So you HAVE to eat to replenish that molecular fuel.
words.defineEn: fill something that had previously been emptied

examples: He admonished his alchemical colleagues not to trust the words of the ancient masters.

Reade claimed that she was admonished for how she dressed by a supervisor, and that that was part of the retaliation.
words.defineEn: to strongly urge or advice a person to take a particular action

examples: The film received lavish praise from critics for its groundbreaking visual effects, compelling storyline, and outstanding performances.

words.defineEn: expend profusely; also used with abstract nouns

examples: Military convoys join routine traffic on the highways.

Derek Chauvin, he had a convoy with him, and that's the other officers.
[laughing] Squishing up your face and gnashing your teeth at other people while uncontrollably grunting and hyperventilating, that’s a very weird thing to do.
Every time a grinder gnashes their back molars together, they exert as much as 200 pounds of pressure per square inch.
For example, fish called grunts gnash their teeth together to make a characteristic grunting sound when distressed.
An ambush in Southern Syria has killed at least 28 people.
This owl is an ambush hunter.
Today’s crocodylians are all aquatic ambush predators.
Can I ambush you in your office? -
Two species of these giants were ambush predators the size of polar bears that roamed Western North America.

examples: The spacecraft rendezvoused with its target in June 2018, snapping a series of pictures that revealed the asteroid's shape.
